result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel M. Cichanowicz

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury Instructions

1:06 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Daniel M. Cichanowicz appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach in court for Daniel M. Cichanowicz.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Notice recipient Judge Katherine Sloma in court. All parties via zoom. CR via zoom from Shawano County Courthouse. Hearing clerked in Langlade County and open to the public. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights was filed. State has filed amended information, Ct. 1 dismissed, Ct. 2 amended and will plea to possession with intent to deliver, Def. to plea Guilty or No Contest, dismiss Ct. 3, Ct. 4 and 5 DRI. Parties are requesting pre-sentence investigation. State will go on higher side regarding initial confinement and no cap on State's recommendations in regards to supervision. State has emailed amended information to Atty Fehrenbach. Atty Fehrenbach is in agreement. Def. is also in agreement. Def. pleas No Contest to Ct. 2. Court reviews plea questionnaire with Def. and all constitutional rights, potential penalties and elements. Def. is advised of firearm and voting rights. Court finds adequate and factual basis and finds Def. is entering pleas freely and voluntarily and finds Def. Guilty on Ct. 2. Court allows Ct. 1 to be dismissed and Ct. 3 dismissed. Ct. 4 and 5 to be dismissed but read in. Court orders PSI. Bond continues. State requests due date for pre-sentence investigation of December 2, 2022 and PSI author does not need to be present. PSI to be done in long form. Atty Fehrenbach efiles jury instructions.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing on September 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: of Judge

1:41 PM Defendant Daniel M. Cichanowicz appeared by video, in custody, via zoom.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach in court, via zoom for Daniel M. Cichanowicz. Atty Fehrenbach has copy of Information, waives reading and has motion to dismiss filed & enters Not Guilty plea and also filed motion for speedy trial and substitution of judge. Court receives Not Guilty plea. Atty Fehrenbach request motion to dismiss hearing be removed for calendar, Court accepts. No new date at this time. Bond remains.

to dismiss multiplicitous counts 
  (Routed to J.A. for Judge)

Amended 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. No leaving the State of Wisconsin. Surrender passport to the Langlade County Sheriff's Department. No contact with female witness.

3:30 PM in Room 203. Defendant Daniel M. Cichanowicz in court, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach in court for Daniel M. Cichanowicz. Dep. Travis Krueger, duly sworn on oath, testifies. The Court finds probable cause, binds over for filing of Information. Arraignment to be set. Attny Fehrenbach argues for bond reduction. Bond argument by State, objects to modification. Remarks by the Court. The Court modifies bond to $12,000 cash with conditions. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. No leaving the State of Wisconsin. Surrender passport to the Langlade County Sheriff's Department. No contact with female witness.
Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on June 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Routed to CC-JA

Atty Fehrenbach has copy of complaint, waives reading and request timely p.h and motion to dismiss.  Atty Fehrenbach will be filing bond motion.

2:50 PM Defendant Daniel M. Cichanowicz appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. has contacted PD. State heard on bond, recommends $20,000 cash bond. Def. questioned as to ability to post bond. The Court orders $20,000 cash bond with conditions no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no contact with Sheena Preisler. Court reserves right to revisit bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
